item.title: 受贸易紧张局势影响，2025 年全球股市将实现温和上涨
item.description: 路透社对股票分析师进行的一项调查显示，基于全球贸易紧张局势和通胀前景恶化阻碍股市上涨的前景，大多数主要股市甚至无法在 2025 年重复今年的低迷表现。【原文：Most major stock markets will fail to even repeat this year's lacklustre performance in 2025 based on the prospect of global trade tensions and a worsening inflation outlook holding back gains, according to a Reuters poll of equity analysts.】

item.title: VIEW 美国 10 月份 PCE 物价通胀率如期走高
item.description: 美国商务部周三表示，10月份个人消费支出（PCE）价格指数攀升0.2%，与9月份未经修正的涨幅持平。【原文：The personal consumption expenditures (PCE) price index climbed 0.2% in October, the Commerce Department said on Wednesday, matching September's unrevised gain.】

item.title: 俄罗斯 VTB 称卢布下跌的背后是美国制裁
item.description: 俄罗斯第二大银行 VTB 的一位高管周三表示，美国对负责能源贸易的俄罗斯第三大银行 Gazprombank 实施的制裁是卢布最近几天自由下跌的原因。【原文：Sanctions imposed by the United States on Russia's third largest lender Gazprombank, which handles the energy trade, are behind the rouble's free fall in recent days, a top executive from VTB, Russia's second largest bank, said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统表示，如果美国先提高关税，墨西哥就会提高关税
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆周二表示，如果当选总统唐纳德-特朗普兑现其威胁，在上任后对墨西哥进口商品征收 25% 的关税，墨西哥将提高从美国进口的关税。【原文：Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Tuesday that Mexico would raise tariffs on imports from the United States if President-elect Donald Trump follows through on his threat to issue a 25% tariff on Mexican imports after taking office.】

item.title: 美国 10 月消费支出稳健增长；通胀率保持高位
item.description: 美国消费者支出在 10 月份稳健增长，表明经济在第四季度初保持了强劲的增长步伐，但在过去几个月中，降低通胀的进展似乎停滞不前。【原文：U.S. consumer spending increased solidly in October, suggesting that the economy maintained its strong pace of growth early in the fourth quarter, but progress lowering inflation appears to have stalled in the past months.】

item.title: NAR 称美国成屋待售连续第三个月增长
item.description: 尽管抵押贷款利率居高不下，待售房产库存持续增加，健康的就业市场也为潜在买家的财务状况提供了保障，但 10 月份美国旧房购买合同出人意料地增加，连续第三个月实现增长。【原文：Contracts to buy U.S. previously owned homes rose unexpectedly in October, notching a third straight month of increases, despite high mortgage rates and as inventory of properties for sale continued to build and a healthy job market fortifies the finances of prospective buyers.】

item.title: Stellantis 将于 12 月停止意大利 Mirafiori 工厂的汽车生产
item.description: 斯特兰蒂斯汽车公司周三表示，将于12月2日至1月5日再次停止意大利米拉菲奥里工厂的汽车组装业务，该工厂生产电动菲亚特500和两款玛莎拉蒂跑车。【原文：Stellantis will halt again auto assembly operations at its Mirafiori plant in Italy, which makes the electric Fiat 500 and two Maserati sport car models, from Dec. 2 to Jan. 5, the automaker said on Wednesday.】

item.title: Blackrock、State Street、Vanguard 因气候协议被共和党州起诉
item.description: 德克萨斯州和其他 10 个由共和党领导的州周三起诉机构投资者 Blackrock、State Street 和 Vanguard，指控他们通过气候激进主义违反了反垄断法，这些州称气候激进主义导致煤炭产量减少。【原文：Texas and 10 other Republican-led states sued institutional investors Blackrock , State Street and Vanguard on Wednesday, accusing them of violating antitrust law through climate activism that the states say led to diminished coal production.】

item.title: 美国零售商试图在更短的假日购物季中激发消费热情
item.description: 为了在 "黑色星期五 "吸引购物者，大型连锁零售商打算展示互动产品和体验，包括雷朋（Ray Ban）的增强现实眼镜、电子产品零售商百思买（Best Buy）的超大电视以及美国连锁百货公司诺德斯特龙（Nordstrom Inc.【原文：To entice shoppers on Black Friday, major retail chains intend to showcase interactive products and experiences, including Ray Ban augmented-reality glasses, extra-extra-large TVs at electronics retailer Best Buy and new spa services at U.S. department store chain Nordstrom Inc .】

item.title: 墨西哥警告特朗普关税将扼杀 40 万个美国就业机会
item.description: 墨西哥是美国最大的贸易伙伴。【原文：Mexico is the United States' top trade partner.】

item.title: 美国第三季度经济增长率未作修正，为 2.8
item.description: 美国政府周三证实，在消费者支出强劲的推动下，美国经济在第三季度实现了稳健增长。【原文：The U.S. economy grew at a solid clip in the third quarter, the government confirmed on Wednesday, amid robust consumer spending.】

item.title: 报告显示，11月美国汽车销量将在更大幅度的折扣中增长
item.description: 据行业咨询公司J.D. Power和GlobalData周三联合发布的报告称，受为清理库存而提高折扣的影响，预计11月份美国新车销量将同比增长6.7%。【原文：New vehicle sales in the U.S. are projected to have risen 6.7% in November from a year earlier, driven by higher discounts to clear elevated inventory, according to a joint report by industry consultants J.D. Power and GlobalData on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国 10 月份核心资本货物订单意外下降
item.description: 10 月份，美国主要制造业资本货物的新订单出人意料地减少，表明本季度企业在设备方面的支出有所放缓。【原文：New orders for key U.S.-manufactured capital goods unexpectedly fell in October, suggesting a moderation in business spending on equipment this quarter.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数进一步下降
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数量再次下降，但许多下岗工人正经历着长期失业，这为美联储在 12 月再次降息敞开了大门。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits fell again last week, but many laid-off workers are experiencing long bouts of joblessness, keeping the door open to another interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve in December.】

item.title: 工会称福特裁员意味着德国工厂的 "逐步死亡
item.description: 德国 IG Metall 工会周三抨击了福特公司削减数千个工作岗位的计划，称重组将意味着这家美国汽车制造商在科隆的生产基地将慢慢死亡。【原文：Germany's IG Metall union lashed out on Wednesday at plans to cut thousands of jobs at Ford, saying that the restructuring would spell a slow death for the U.S. automaker's production site in Cologne.】

item.title: 宜家高管：贸易关税加大了保持低价的难度
item.description: 全球最大家具零售商宜家的首席财务官周三告诉路透社，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普计划征收的关税将使宜家更难保持低价。【原文：Tariffs planned by U.S. President-elect Donald Trump will make it harder for IKEA to keep prices low, the chief financial officer of the world's biggest furniture retailer told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 最大的宜家零售商因降价影响销售而遭受利润打击
item.description: 全球最大的宜家家具零售商宜家家居（IKEA）周三公布年度净利润大幅下降，原因是该公司试图通过降价吸引更多注重成本的顾客光顾其蓝色大卖场。【原文：The world's biggest retailer of IKEA furniture on Wednesday reported a big drop in annual net profit after cutting prices in an attempt to coax more cost-conscious shoppers into its big blue stores.】

item.title: 即使房价上涨放缓，美国住房负担能力仍将恶化
item.description: 路透社对房地产专家进行的一项民意调查显示，由于供应紧张和美联储仅再下调几次利率，未来一年美国首次购房者的购房负担能力将进一步恶化，即使平均房价涨幅放缓。【原文：Purchasing affordability for first-time U.S. homebuyers will worsen over the coming year on tight supply and just a few more Federal Reserve interest rate cuts, even as average home price rises slow, according to a Reuters poll of property experts.】

item.title: Avolta 赢得肯尼迪机场合同，是其 2024 年在北美最大的合同之一
item.description: 瑞士免税零售商 Avolta 周三表示，该公司赢得了一项从 2026 年起在纽约肯尼迪国际机场经营多家免税店、旅游便利店和特色零售店的合约，这是该公司今年在北美签订的最大合约之一。【原文：Avolta has won a deal to operate several duty-free, travel convenience and specialty retail stores at New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport from 2026, one of its largest contracts in North America this year, the Swiss duty-free retailer said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 德国内阁批准改善资本市场准入的措施
item.description: 德国政府消息人士告诉路透社，德国内阁周三批准了一揽子促进初创企业发展和改善资本市场准入的措施，但目前还不清楚议会是否会在二月大选前批准这些措施。【原文：The German cabinet on Wednesday approved a package of measures to promote startups and improve access to capital markets, government sources told Reuters, though it is unclear whether it will also be green-lit by parliament before February elections.】

item.title: 关于阿达尼美国贿赂案起诉书您需要了解的信息
item.description: 印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）因涉嫌参与一项价值 2.65 亿美元的贿赂计划而被美国当局起诉，这在他的同名港口大豆企业集团中引起了轩然大波。阿达尼集团否认了这些指控。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's indictment by U.S. authorities for his alleged role in a $265 million bribery scheme has sent shockwaves through his eponymous ports-to-soybeans conglomerate. The Adani Group denies the allegations.】

item.title: 烈酒行业寻求豁免特朗普的普遍关税
item.description: 一个代表顶级烈酒制造商的贸易机构告诉路透社，烈酒行业正计划推动豁免即将上任的特朗普政府对美国进口产品征收的任何普遍关税。【原文：The spirits industry is planning to push for an exemption to any universal tariffs on U.S. imports imposed by the incoming Trump administration, a trade body representing top spirits makers told Reuters.】

item.title: 惠普、戴尔预测疲软引发股价大跌，PC 市场复苏存疑
item.description: 戴尔和惠普的股价周三下跌，因为这两家个人电脑制造商发布的预测对人工智能个人电脑推动的市场复苏表示怀疑。【原文：Shares of Dell and HP fell on Wednesday after the personal computer makers issued forecasts that cast doubt on a market recovery driven by artificial intelligence-enabled PCs.】

item.title: 投资者等待美国关键数据，多伦多证券交易所期货上涨
item.description: 与加拿大主要股指挂钩的期货周三小幅上涨，因为投资者在等待当天晚些时候美国的关键通胀数据，以判断美联储的货币政策前景。【原文：Futures tied to Canada's main stock index rose slightly on Wednesday, as investors awaited key U.S. inflation data later in the day to gauge the Federal Reserve's monetary policy outlook.】

item.title: 通胀数据公布前市场谨慎，期货下跌
item.description: 美国股指期货周三下滑，因为投资者在等待关键的经济数据，包括一份至关重要的通胀报告，预计该报告将影响美联储未来的货币政策路径。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Wednesday as investors awaited key economic data, including a crucial inflation report, which is expected to influence the Federal Reserve's future monetary policy path.】

item.title: 瑞士信贷银行在 2022 年可卡因洗钱案中被判无罪释放
item.description: 瑞士一高级法院周三宣判瑞士信贷银行（Credit Suisse）在 2022 年的一项刑事判决中无罪释放，该银行现在是瑞银集团（UBS）的一部分，被认定未能阻止一个保加利亚可卡因贩运团伙的洗钱活动。【原文：A top Swiss court on Wednesday acquitted Credit Suisse of a 2022 criminal conviction when the bank that is now part of UBS was found guilty of failing to prevent money laundering by a Bulgarian cocaine trafficking gang.】

item.title: 美国假期美国关注通胀，法国局势紧张
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: Citgo 股票拍卖陷入困境，美国法院准备重启计划
item.description: 一位法院顾问周二建议，为支付对委内瑞拉的索赔而进行的 Citgo Petroleum (PDVSAC.UL) 母公司股份拍卖需要彻底改变，并承认长达一年之久的拍卖过程一团糟，需要重新开始。【原文：An auction of shares in a Citgo Petroleum (PDVSAC.UL) parent to pay claims against Venezuela needs to be overhauled, a court adviser recommended on Tuesday, conceding a year-long sale process was in shambles and needed to start fresh.】

item.title: 消息人士称，CFM 重新分配部分发动机，以促进空中客车公司的发展
item.description: 三位熟知内情的人士透露，喷气发动机制造商CFM公司已同意向空中客车公司提供部分发动机，以缩小供应缺口，因为空中客车公司正在努力实现年底目标。【原文：Jet engine maker CFM has agreed to divert some engines to Airbus to narrow a supply gap as the planemaker battles to hit end-year targets, three people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 现代汽车因后视摄像头显示问题在美国召回超过 22.6 万辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，由于后视摄像头图像可能无法显示，现代汽车公司将在美国召回226,118辆汽车。【原文：Hyundai Motor is recalling 226,118 vehicles in the U.S. over concerns the rear view camera image may fail to display, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】
